org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed.ace

Class AceContigBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed.ace.AceContigBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContigBuilder<AceAssembledRead,AceContig>, Builder<AceContig>

    public final class AceContigBuilder
extends Object
implements ContigBuilder<AceAssembledRead,AceContig>
    Builder for AceContigs that allows creating AceContig objects read by read by adding assembled reads and setting a consensus. An AceContigBuilder can be used to create AceContig objects that have been created by an assembler or can be used to create contigs from "scratch". There are additional methods to allow the contig consensus or underlying reads to be modified before the creation of the AceContig instance (which is immutable).

    This class is not thread-safe.

    Author:
    dkatzel

      • AceContigBuilder

        public AceContigBuilder(String contigId,
                        String initialConsensus)
        Create a new AceContigBuilder for a contig with the given contig id and starting with the given consensus. Both the contig id and the consensus can be changed by calling methods on the returned builder.
        Parameters:
        contigId - the initial contig id to use for this contig (may later be changed)
        initialConsensus - the initial contig consensus for this contig (may be changed later)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if contigId or consensus are null.

      • AceContigBuilder

        public AceContigBuilder(String contigId,
                        ConsensusCaller consensusCaller)

      • AceContigBuilder

        public AceContigBuilder(String contigId,
                        ConsensusCaller consensusCaller,
                        QualitySequenceDataStore qualityDataStore,
                        GapQualityValueStrategy qualityValueStrategy)
        Create a new AceContigBuilder for a de novo contig that will have the given contig id. There is initially, no consensus (getConsensusBuilder() will return null) Once reads are added and the contig is built by calling build() the consensus will be created by using the underlying read information to call consensus using the given ConsensusCaller, QualitySequenceDataStore and GapQualityValueStrategy.
        Parameters:
        contigId - the initial contig id to use for this contig (may later be changed) ConsensusCaller and QualitySequenceDataStore which contains the quality data for all of the reads in this ace contig. The consensus will get recalled inside the build() and recallConsensusNow(). method before the AceContig instance is created.
        consensusCaller - the ConsensusCaller instance to use to recall the consensus of this contig; can not be null.
        qualityDataStore - the QualitySequenceDataStore which contains all the quality data for all of the reads that will be added to this contig; can not be null.
        qualityValueStrategy - the GapQualityValueStrategy that will be used to compute the quality values of all of the read's gaps.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any of the parameters are null.

      • AceContigBuilder

        public AceContigBuilder(String contigId,
                        NucleotideSequence initialConsensus,
                        int estimatedNumberOfReads)
        Create a new AceContigBuilder for a contig with the given contig id and starting with the given consensus. Both the contig id and the consensus can be changed by calling methods on the returned builder.
        Parameters:
        contigId - the initial contig id to use for this contig (may later be changed)
        initialConsensus - the initial contig consensus for this contig (may be changed later)
        estimatedNumberOfReads - expected number of reads that will be added to this contig. This value is only used to allocate the initial map sizes for internal data structures as a performance optimization. Must be ≥0.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if contigId or consensus are null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if estimatedNumberOfReads is < 0

        copy - the AceContig to copy can not be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if copy is null.

      • setComplemented

        public AceContigBuilder setComplemented(boolean complemented)
        Set this contig as being complemented. This does not actually modify either the consensus or underlying read sequences. If you wish to actually reverse complement the basecalls you must use call NucleotideSequenceBuilder.reverseComplement() method on the consensus builder returned by getConsensusBuilder() and on each underlying read using getAllAssembledReadBuilders().
        Parameters:
        complemented - is this ace contig complemented or not.
        Returns:
        this

      • recallConsensus

        public AceContigBuilder recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller consensusCaller,
                                        QualitySequenceDataStore qualityDataStore,
                                        GapQualityValueStrategy qualityValueStrategy)
        Recall the consensus using the given ConsensusCaller and QualitySequenceDataStore which contains the quality data for all of the reads in this ace contig. The consensus will get recalled inside the build() and recallConsensusNow(). method before the AceContig instance is created.
        Specified by:
        recallConsensus in interface ContigBuilder<AceAssembledRead,AceContig>
        Parameters:
        consensusCaller - the ConsensusCaller instance to use to recall the consensus of this contig; can not be null.
        qualityDataStore - the QualitySequenceDataStore which contains all the quality data for all of the reads in this contig; can not be null. This value will override the quality datastore set by computeConsensusQualities(QualitySequenceDataStore) and vice versa, last one called wins. (This is more for user's convenience in case they don't want to do one or the other).
        qualityValueStrategy - the GapQualityValueStrategy that will be used to compute the quality values of all of the read's gaps.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any parameter is null.

      • updateConsensusRecaller

        public AceContigBuilder updateConsensusRecaller(ConsensusCaller consensusCaller)

      • computeConsensusQualities

        public AceContigBuilder computeConsensusQualities()
        Compute the consensus Qualities using the same algorithm that consed uses. The read quality values will be taken from the QualitySequenceDataStore set by recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller, QualitySequenceDataStore, GapQualityValueStrategy). If you do not wish to recall consensus, then use computeConsensusQualities(QualitySequenceDataStore). If this method is not specified AND setInitialConsensusQualities(QualitySequence) is not called, then the consensus qualities will be set to a dummy value of all 30.
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        computeConsensusQualities(QualitySequenceDataStore)

      • computeConsensusQualities

        public AceContigBuilder computeConsensusQualities(QualitySequenceDataStore readQualityDataStore)
        Compute the consensus Qualities using the same algorithm that consed uses. The read quality values will be taken from the given QualitySequenceDataStore. If this method is not specified AND setInitialConsensusQualities(QualitySequence) is not called, then the consensus qualities will be set to a dummy value of all 30.
        Parameters:
        readQualityDataStore - the QualitySequenceDataStore to use to compute consensus qualities. This value will override the quality datastore set by recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller, QualitySequenceDataStore, GapQualityValueStrategy) and vice versa, last one called wins. (This is more for user's convenience in case they don't want to do one or the other).
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if readQualityDataStore is null.

      • recallConsensus

        public AceContigBuilder recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller consensusCaller)
        Recall the consensus using the given ConsensusCaller using faked quality data where all basecalls (and gaps) all get the same quality value. The consensus will get recalled inside the build() and from recallConsensusNow(). method before the AceContig instance is created.
        Specified by:
        recallConsensus in interface ContigBuilder<AceAssembledRead,AceContig>
        Parameters:
        consensusCaller - the ConsensusCaller instance to use to recall the consensus of this contig; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any parameter is null.

      • getAllAssembledReadBuilders

        public Collection<AceAssembledReadBuilder> getAllAssembledReadBuilders()
        Get a collection of all the AssembledReadBuilders that are currently associated with this contig. This collection is backed by the contig builder so any changes to the returned collection or modifications to any of its AssembledReadBuilders will modify the contig as well.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        a a collection of all the AssembledReadBuilder that are currently associated with this contig; never null.

      • addRead

        public AceContigBuilder addRead(String readId,
                                NucleotideSequence validBases,
                                int offset,
                                Direction dir,
                                Range clearRange,
                                PhdInfo phdInfo,
                                int ungappedFullLength)
        Add a read to this contig with the given values. This read can later get modified via the getAssembledReadBuilder(String). The read to be added must be fully contained
        Parameters:
        readId - the id this read should have
        validBases - the gapped bases of this read that align (however well/badly) to this contig and will be used as underlying sequence data for this contig.
        offset - the gapped start offset of this read into the contig consensus.
        dir - the Direction of this read.
        clearRange - the ungapped clear range of the valid bases relative to the full length non-trimmed raw full length read from the sequence machine.
        phdInfo - the PhdInfo object for this read.
        ungappedFullLength - the ungapped full length non-trimmed raw full length read from the sequence machine.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameters are null
        IllegalArgumentException - if a read with the same readId already exists in this contig.

      • getConsensusBuilder

        public NucleotideSequenceBuilder getConsensusBuilder()
        Get the NucleotideSequenceBuilder instance that will be the consensus in the built contig, any changes to the returned instance will modify the consensus in this contig.
        Specified by:
        getConsensusBuilder in interface ContigBuilder<AceAssembledRead,AceContig>
        Returns:
        the NucleotideSequenceBuilder for this contig's consensus, never null.

      • build

        public AceContig build()
        Create a new instance using the data collected by this builder thus far.

        Take the current read and consensus data (which has possibly been previous edited and/or shifted) and create a new AceContig instance. Calling this method might release resources or destroy temp data that is required to built this contig, therefore this method should be only called once per builder instance. If this method is called more than once, then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        build in interface ContigBuilder<AceAssembledRead,AceContig>
        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<AceContig>
        Returns:
        a new AceContig instance, never null.

      • recallConsensusNow

        public AceContigBuilder recallConsensusNow()
        Recompute the contig consensus now using the current reads in the contig using the ConsensusCaller and optional quality data that was set by recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller) or recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller, QualitySequenceDataStore, GapQualityValueStrategy). Only regions of the contig that have read coverage get recalled. The Consensus of "0x" regions remains unchanged. If this method is called without first setting a ConsensusCaller, then this method will throw an IllegalStateException.

        Recomputing the contig consensus may be computationally expensive and time consuming. So this method should not be called on a regular basis. Also, the contig consensus will always get recalled during build() even if this method has already been called since it is too hard to track if any underlying read changes occurred in between.

        Specified by:
        recallConsensusNow in interface ContigBuilder<AceAssembledRead,AceContig>
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a consensus caller was not first set using recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller) or recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller, QualitySequenceDataStore, GapQualityValueStrategy).
        See Also:
        build()

      • split

        public SortedMap<Range,AceContigBuilder> split(Collection<Range> rangesToKeep)
        Split the contents of the current ContigBuilder into possibly multiple new ContigBuilders. The returned ContigBuilders will be new instances which only contain the reads and consensus of the initial contig that intersects the input rangesToKeep. If a ConsensusCaller and related QualitySequenceDataStore and GapQualityValueStrategy were set via recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller) or recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller, QualitySequenceDataStore, GapQualityValueStrategy) then those values are copied as well.
        Parameters:
        rangesToKeep - The Ranges of the contig to make into new contigs. For each range given, a new ContigBuilder instance is created which contains only the reads and portion of the consensus sequence that intersects that range in the original contig. If a read extends beyond the input range, then that read sequence is trimmed. If a read spans multiple input ranges, then it will exist (but trimmed) in multiple returned contig Builders. If the given ranges to keep are overlapping, then the returned contigBuilders will also be overlapping. Each returned contigBuilder will have all have the same contig id this contigBuilder. It is up to the client to modify or remove reads and change the returned contig ids so that the final contigs meet the desired uniqueness constraints
        Returns:
        a new Map, sorted by Range arrival, each entry value in the map is a new contigBuilder which contains only the portion of this contig at that particular entry key range. The same id is used for all the returned split contigBuilders so be sure to rename them using setContigId(String) to make them unique.
